nodes.bodyText: Oops realized I agreed with this idea in the issue but not after looking closer. I think this should take a MethodDescriptor too so the path can refer to a specific method. Would allow "/hello" to point to the Hello method. "/foo/Hello" still isn't so idiomatic
I see. By the way, is not MethodDescriptor too lower level for users? How about adding an option for method naming strategy such camelCase, snake_case, directory/style and so on.

Yeah it's an interesting point. But since MethodDescriptor is type safe, it seems both nice and direct as well as less chance of bugs, and I guess less cognitive load? It's not intuitive to me what sort of system we'd provide for renaming without thinking more deeply, so maybe the end result also won't be able intuitive. Not sure though.

But since MethodDescriptor is type safe, it seems both nice and direct as well as less chance of bugs, and I guess less cognitive load?

Agreed. A specific MethodDescriptor would be better than an ambiguous conversion.
Let me address it. 😀
IIRC we did not add final rigorously in this class because it's forked and we wanted to apply any changes from the upstream in the future.
Yeap, let me revert this. :-)
